title: Setup GitHub repository in EphemeralDSP account
description:
Create and configure the ultrawave GitHub repository under the EphemeralDSP organization using gh CLI.

## Prerequisites
- Ensure gh CLI is installed and authenticated to EphemeralDSP account

## Steps

### 1. Authenticate gh CLI
```bash
gh auth login
# Select GitHub.com
# Select HTTPS
# Authenticate with browser or token
```

### 2. Create Repository
```bash
gh repo create EphemeralDSP/ultrawave \
  --public \
  --description "VST/CLAP plugin emulating Elektron Machinedrum UW RAM machines" \
  --license MIT \
  --gitignore Rust
```

### 3. Configure Repository Settings
```bash
# Enable issues
gh repo edit EphemeralDSP/ultrawave --enable-issues

# Add topics for discoverability
gh repo edit EphemeralDSP/ultrawave --add-topic vst --add-topic clap --add-topic audio-plugin --add-topic rust --add-topic dsp --add-topic elektron --add-topic sampler
```

### 4. Link Local Repository to Remote
```bash
git remote add origin https://github.com/EphemeralDSP/ultrawave.git
git branch -M main
git push -u origin main
```

### 5. Create Initial Labels for Issues
```bash
gh label create "P0-critical" --color "b60205" --description "Critical priority"
gh label create "P1-high" --color "d93f0b" --description "High priority"  
gh label create "P2-medium" --color "fbca04" --description "Medium priority"
gh label create "P3-low" --color "0e8a16" --description "Low priority"
gh label create "dsp" --color "1d76db" --description "DSP/audio processing"
gh label create "plugin-framework" --color "5319e7" --description "VST/CLAP framework"
gh label create "gui" --color "f9d0c4" --description "GUI/interface"
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] gh CLI authenticated to EphemeralDSP account
- [ ] Repository created at github.com/EphemeralDSP/ultrawave
- [ ] Repository is public with MIT license
- [ ] Topics added for discoverability
- [ ] Local repo linked to remote origin
- [ ] Initial push successful (all existing commits on GitHub)
- [ ] Issue labels created for project management
- [ ] `git status` shows "up to date with origin/main"

title: Implement RAM RECORD recording logic
description:
Implement the recording engine for RAM RECORD machines (R1-R4).

## Recording Flow
1. On TRIG: Start recording to allocated buffer
2. Mix Main outputs (MLEV/MBAL) + External inputs (ILEV/IBAL)
3. Apply RATE parameter for quality/memory tradeoff
4. Record for duration specified by LEN parameter
5. Stop recording when LEN reached or manually stopped

## Technical Requirements
- Sample-accurate recording start (aligned to audio buffer)
- Real-time level mixing with MLEV/MBAL/ILEV/IBAL
- Sample rate reduction based on RATE parameter (0-127 → 4kHz-44.1kHz)
- Proper handling of buffer overrun
- Support for re-triggering (restart recording)

## Recording Quality (RATE parameter):
- RATE=127: Full quality (44.1kHz)
- RATE=64: Half quality (~22kHz)
- RATE=0: Lowest quality (~4kHz)
- Lower RATE values use less DSP memory

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Recording starts on MIDI note trigger
- [ ] Main output and external input mixing works
- [ ] RATE parameter correctly affects recording quality
- [ ] LEN parameter correctly limits recording duration
- [ ] Re-trigger restarts recording from beginning
- [ ] No audio glitches during recording

title: Implement time-stretching and pitch shifting
description:
Implement time-stretching and pitch shifting for RAM PLAY machines.

## Important Note
Per technical_specs.md: **Machinedrum UW does NOT have dedicated time-stretch algorithms.** Time-stretching effects are achieved through:
- Sample rate manipulation (SR/PITCH parameter)
- LFO modulation of playback parameters
- Parameter locks (P-locks) on STRT parameter

## Implementation Approach

### 1. Primary Method: Sample Rate Manipulation
- PITCH parameter (0-127) controls playback speed
- PITCH=64 = original speed
- PITCH=127 = ~2x speed (octave up)
- PITCH=0 = ~0.25x speed (2 octaves down)

### 2. LFO-Based Time Effects
- LFO modulating STRT creates "swimming" effect
- LFO modulating PITCH creates vibrato/wow

### 3. P-Lock Technique (for future sequencer)
- Place trigs with different STRT values
- RTRG + RTIM for tempo-locked loops
- Document this technique for users

## Optional: Phase Vocoder (enhanced mode)
If implementing enhanced time-stretch:
- NORMAL algorithm: Standard phase vocoder
- BEAT algorithm: Transient-preserving vocoder
- OFF: Pure sample rate method (authentic)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] PITCH parameter affects playback rate correctly
- [ ] Pitch range covers at least 2 octaves up/down
- [ ] Linear interpolation maintains quality
- [ ] LFO modulation of PITCH works smoothly
- [ ] LFO modulation of STRT creates intended effect
- [ ] Documentation explains authentic technique
- [ ] Optional phase vocoder (if implemented)
acceptance_criteria: Time-stretching works across reasonable ranges without significant artifacts. Pitch shifting maintains audio quality. Formant preservation option functions correctly. Processing latency is acceptable for real-time use.

title: Implement RAM machine shared memory buffer system
description:
Implement the shared DSP memory system for RAM machines as specified in ELEKTRON appendix A-15.

## Requirements
- Create shared memory pool for RAM machine audio buffers
- Support 4 independent recording buffers (R1-R4)
- Support 4 independent playback buffers (P1-P4)
- Implement memory allocation tracking (used/available)
- Handle memory exhaustion gracefully (as per RATE parameter behavior)

## Implementation Details
- Default buffer size: 2 bars at 44.1kHz (approximately 2.5MB total)
- Buffer format: mono 12-bit (stored as i16)
- Thread-safe access for concurrent record/playback

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] allocate_buffer() returns buffer handle or error when full
- [ ] deallocate_buffer() properly frees memory
- [ ] get_memory_usage() returns percentage used
- [ ] Unit tests pass for allocation/deallocation
- [ ] Memory access is thread-safe (no data races)

title: Implement RAM PLAY playback engine
description:
Implement the playback engine for RAM PLAY machines (P1-P4).

## Playback Requirements
- Play from corresponding RAM RECORD buffer (P1→R1, P2→R2, etc.)
- Linear interpolation for pitch shifting
- Support all playback parameters (STRT, END, PITCH, etc.)
- Re-triggering behavior matches ROM machines

## Playback Features
- Variable start/end points (STRT/END 0-127 → buffer position)
- Sample rate/pitch control (PITCH 64=original, higher=faster)
- Retrigger support (RTRG/RTIM for stutter effects)
- Hold/decay envelope
- BRR (bit rate reduction) for lo-fi playback

## Technical Details
- 12-bit playback (matches Machinedrum character)
- Linear interpolation for non-integer sample positions
- Proper handling of empty buffers (silence or last recorded)
- One-shot and looping modes

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Playback reads from correct RAM RECORD buffer
- [ ] STRT/END correctly select playback region
- [ ] PITCH parameter affects playback speed correctly
- [ ] Retrigger (RTRG/RTIM) creates stutter effects
- [ ] BRR creates authentic lo-fi character
- [ ] Linear interpolation avoids aliasing
- [ ] Empty buffer handling (no crashes)

title: Implement effects chains and processors
description:
Implement the track effects chain as specified in ELEKTRON Machinedrum UW.

## Track Effects (5 concurrent per voice)

### 1. Amplitude Modulation (AMM)
- Depth: 0-127
- Rate: 0-127 (tempo-synced)
- Ring modulation character

### 2. 1-Band EQ
- Frequency: 0-127 (20Hz-20kHz)
- Gain: 0-127 (-12dB to +12dB)
- Peak/shelf modes

### 3. Sample Rate Reduction (SRR)
- Amount: 0-127
- Reduces effective sample rate (44.1kHz → 4kHz)
- Creates lo-fi/bitcrushed character
- Implementation: sample-and-hold

### 4. Distortion (DIST)
- Drive: 0-127
- Gain: 0-127 (makeup gain)
- Waveshaping algorithm (tanh or soft-clip)

### 5. Resonant Filter (separate task ultrawave-d6n)

## Effect Processing Order
```
Input → AMM → EQ → Filter → SRR → Distortion → Output
```

## Technical Requirements
- All effects bypassable
- Parameters smoothed
- No inter-effect aliasing

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] AMM implements ring modulation
- [ ] EQ provides ±12dB boost/cut
- [ ] SRR creates authentic lo-fi sound
- [ ] Distortion provides warm overdrive
- [ ] Effects chain order matches ELEKTRON
- [ ] All effects can be bypassed individually
- [ ] CPU usage < 2% for full chain
acceptance_criteria: All effects process audio correctly without artifacts. Effects routing is flexible and intuitive. Tempo-sync works properly with DAW. CPU usage stays within acceptable limits for multiple instances.

title: Implement RAM RECORD and RAM PLAY machines with exact ELEKTRON appendix A-15 specifications
description:
Implement the core RAM RECORD (R1-R4) and RAM PLAY (P1-P4) machines exactly as specified in ELEKTRON appendix A-15. This includes all parameters, behaviors, and the complete recording/playback workflow tutorial.

## RAM RECORD Machines (R1-R4) Implementation:
- **MLEV (Main Level)**: Sets level of internal sound from Main outputs
  - Range: 0-127
  - Behavior: 0 = record 'as is', positive = increase volume, negative = decrease volume
- **MBAL (Main Balance)**: Monophonic recording balance from Main outputs
  - Range: 0-127
  - Purpose: Controls stereo balance when recording monophonically
- **ILEV (Input Level)**: Sets level from external inputs
  - Range: 0-127  
  - Behavior: 0 = record 'as is', positive = increase volume, negative = decrease volume
- **IBAL (Input Balance)**: Monophonic recording balance from external inputs
  - Range: 0-127
  - Purpose: Controls stereo balance for external input recording
- **CUE1**: Pre-listening level for Main/external inputs
  - Range: 0-127
  - Warning: Can generate feedback if set too high
- **CUE2**: Pre-listening level for recording trigger
  - Range: 0-127
  - Purpose: Monitor what will be recorded when RAM RECORD is triggered
- **LEN (Length)**: Recording duration
  - Range: 0-127
  - Behavior: 127 = 2 bars, each parameter step = 1/64 step
  - DSP Memory: Lower values save DSP memory when running low
- **RATE**: Recording quality control
  - Range: 0-127
  - Behavior: Lower values = lower quality, saves DSP memory

## RAM PLAY Machines (P1-P4) Implementation:
- **Functionality**: Must function EXACTLY like ROM machines 25-48
- **Complete Parameter Set**:
  - Start (0-127): Linear start point in sample
  - End (0-127): Linear end point in sample
  - Length (0-127): Playback duration
  - Hold (0-127): Sample sustain/decay time
  - Sample Rate (0-127): Playback speed/pitch
  - Decay (0-127): Sample envelope
  - Trigger (0-127): When sample plays
  - Repeats (0-127): Number of repeats

## Tutorial Workflow Implementation:
Implement the complete ELEKTRON appendix A-15 tutorial workflow:
1. Recording from Main outputs with MLEV=0, ILEV=-64
2. LEN=64 and RATE=127 for 1-bar maximum quality capture
3. Parameter-locked STRT manipulation (value 16 example)
4. Real-time recording and playback with CUE monitoring
5. RAM RECORD machine captures both internal and external sounds
6. RAM PLAY machine plays back corresponding RAM RECORD capture

## Technical Requirements:
- 4 RAM RECORD machines (R1-R4) for capturing sound
- 4 RAM PLAY machines (P1-P4) for playback
- Shared DSP memory management (mentioned in appendix)
- Sample-accurate timing for recording triggers
- Real-time parameter updates during recording/playback
- Integration with existing track effects and modulation system
- Proper DSP memory allocation and management

## Acceptance Criteria:
- All 8 RAM machines (4 RECORD + 4 PLAY) implement exact appendix A-15 parameter behavior
- Tutorial workflow works identically to ELEKTRON hardware
- RAM PLAY machines function exactly like ROM machines 25-48
- All parameter ranges and behaviors match hardware specifications
- DSP memory management prevents crashes when memory is low
- CUE monitoring system provides real-time feedback
- Parameter locks and modulation work correctly with all RAM parameters

title: Implement multi-mode filter system
description:
Implement the 24dB resonant multi-mode filter system as specified in technical_specs.md.

## Filter Types Required
- Low-pass (LP) - 24dB/octave
- Band-pass (BP) - 24dB/octave  
- High-pass (HP) - 24dB/octave

## Parameters
| Parameter | Range | Description |
|-----------|-------|-------------|
| FLTF | 0-127 | Filter cutoff frequency (20Hz-20kHz) |
| FLTQ | 0-127 | Filter resonance/Q |
| FLTW | 0-127 | Filter bandwidth |

## Implementation Approach
- Use biquad (Direct Form II) IIR filter topology
- Two cascaded first-order sections for 24dB slope
- Resonant peak via feedback loop
- Drive/saturation at high resonance (soft clipping)

## Technical Requirements
- Parameter smoothing to prevent zipper noise
- Frequency response matches ELEKTRON spec
- Self-oscillation at maximum resonance
- Stable at all parameter combinations

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] FilterParams struct with FLTF, FLTQ, FLTW
- [ ] LP/BP/HP filter modes implemented
- [ ] 24dB/octave slope verified
- [ ] No zipper noise during parameter automation
- [ ] Self-oscillation at Q=127
- [ ] CPU usage < 1% per filter instance
- [ ] Unit tests for frequency response
acceptance_criteria: All filter modes function correctly. Resonance and drive parameters work as expected. Filter envelope is smooth and predictable. Filter sound closely matches Elektron character. CPU usage remains reasonable.

title: Implement CUE monitoring system for RAM machines
description:
Implement the CUE1 and CUE2 pre-listening system for RAM machines.

## CUE System Purpose
- CUE1: Pre-listen to Main outputs + External inputs BEFORE recording
- CUE2: Pre-listen to what will be captured when recording triggers

## Implementation
- CUE output routes to separate monitoring bus (or headphone output)
- CUE1 level controls input monitoring volume
- CUE2 level controls recording preview volume
- Warning: High CUE1 can create feedback loops

## Signal Flow
```
Main Outputs ─┬─► MLEV/MBAL ─┬─► Recording Buffer
              │              │
External In ──┼─► ILEV/IBAL ─┤
              │              │
              ├─► CUE1 ──────┼─► CUE Output Bus
              └─► CUE2 ──────┘
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] CUE1 allows pre-listening of inputs before recording
- [ ] CUE2 allows hearing what will be recorded on trigger
- [ ] CUE output separate from main output
- [ ] No feedback loops at reasonable CUE levels
- [ ] CUE levels smoothly adjustable (no clicks)

title: Implement sample loading and management system
description:
Implement the sample loading and management system.

## Responsibilities
- Load audio files (WAV, AIFF, FLAC)
- Convert to internal 12-bit mono format
- Manage sample memory pool
- Provide sample browser interface data

## Supported Formats
- WAV: 16/24/32-bit, any sample rate
- AIFF: 16/24-bit
- FLAC: lossless compression

## Sample Processing Pipeline
1. Load file using audio decoder
2. Convert to mono (sum L+R or select channel)
3. Resample to 44.1kHz if needed
4. Quantize to 12-bit range
5. Store in SampleBuffer

## Memory Management
- Track total memory usage
- Support sample hot-swapping
- Handle memory pressure gracefully

## Technical Requirements
- Non-blocking load (background thread)
- Progress reporting for large files
- Error handling for corrupt files

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Automatic mono conversion
- [ ] Resampling to 44.1kHz
- [ ] 12-bit quantization applied
- [ ] Memory usage tracking
- [ ] Load progress callback
- [ ] Graceful handling of invalid files
- [ ] Unit tests for format conversion
acceptance_criteria: Successfully loads and plays various audio formats. Handles large sample files without memory issues. Sample switching is seamless without audio glitches. Memory usage stays within reasonable limits.

title: Implement LFO and modulation system
description:
Implement the dual-waveform LFO and modulation system.

## LFO Specifications (per ELEKTRON)
- 16 independent LFOs (one per track concept, but we'll use per-voice)
- Dual waveform generators (SHP1 + SHP2)
- Tempo-synchronized rates

## Waveforms Required
- Sine, Triangle, Sawtooth, Square, Random
- Exponential, Ramp (optional SHP2 variants)
- Dual-waveform mixing for custom shapes

## LFO Rate Table (tempo-synced)
| Value | Period |
|-------|--------|
| 1 | 2 bars |
| 2 | 1 bar |
| 4 | 1/2 bar |
| 8 | 1/4 bar |
| 16 | 1/8 bar |
| 32 | 1/16 bar |
| 64 | 1/32 bar |

## Modulation Targets
All sample/filter/effect parameters can be LFO targets:
- STRT, END, PITCH (sample)
- FLTF, FLTQ (filter)
- VOL, PAN (output)
- Any effect parameter

## Technical Requirements
- Output smoothing (~300Hz low-pass) to prevent zipper noise
- Per-sample update for audio-rate modulation
- Trigger modes: Free, Trigger, Hold, One-Shot

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] LFO struct with rate, depth, waveform, phase
- [ ] All standard waveforms implemented
- [ ] Tempo sync works correctly
- [ ] Modulation depth is bipolar (-64 to +63 style)
- [ ] Smoothing prevents zipper noise
- [ ] One-shot and trigger modes work
- [ ] LFO-to-LFO modulation (optional)
acceptance_criteria: LFO waveforms are accurate and smooth. Rate control covers full range from slow to audio rate. Modulation assignments work for all target parameters. Parameter changes are smooth without zipper noise.

title: Implement core sample playback engine
description:
Implement the core 12-bit sample playback engine matching Machinedrum UW behavior.

## Core Features
- 12-bit sample playback (i16 storage, quantized output)
- Variable playback rate (pitch shifting)
- Linear interpolation (confirmed ELEKTRON method)
- Start/end point control
- Loop modes (one-shot, loop)

## Parameters
| Parameter | Range | Description |
|-----------|-------|-------------|
| STRT | 0-127 | Sample start position |
| END | 0-127 | Sample end position |
| PITCH | 0-127 | Playback speed (64=original) |
| HOLD | 0-127 | Sustain time |
| DEC | 0-127 | Decay amount |

## Technical Implementation
- Fractional sample position with accumulator
- Linear interpolation between samples:
  ```rust
  output = sample[i] * (1 - frac) + sample[i+1] * frac
  ```
- 12-bit quantization for authentic character:
  ```rust
  output = (output * 2048.0).round() / 2048.0
  ```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] SamplePlayback struct with position, rate, buffer ref
- [ ] Variable pitch playback (0.5x to 2x range minimum)
- [ ] Linear interpolation implemented correctly
- [ ] 12-bit quantization adds expected character
- [ ] STRT/END correctly map to buffer positions
- [ ] No clicks at sample start/end
- [ ] CPU usage < 0.5% per voice
acceptance_criteria: Sample playback is sample-accurate and glitch-free. Start/stop points work correctly. Pitch control functions properly. Basic envelope shapes implemented. Parameter changes are smooth without artifacts.

title: Setup project structure and dependencies
description:
Initialize Rust project with nih-plugin framework and establish the project structure.

## Steps

### 1. Initialize Cargo Project
```bash
cargo init --name ultrawave
```

### 2. Configure Cargo.toml
Add nih-plug dependencies:
```toml
[package]
name = "ultrawave"
version = "0.1.0"
edition = "2021"
authors = ["EphemeralDSP"]
license = "MIT"
description = "Elektron Machinedrum UW RAM machine emulation"

[lib]
crate-type = ["cdylib"]

[dependencies]
nih_plug = { git = "https://github.com/robbert-vdh/nih-plug.git" }
nih_plug_egui = { git = "https://github.com/robbert-vdh/nih-plug.git" }

[profile.release]
lto = "thin"
strip = "symbols"
```

### 3. Create Directory Structure
```
src/
  lib.rs           # Plugin entry point
  plugin.rs        # Main plugin struct
  params.rs        # Parameter definitions
  dsp/
    mod.rs         # DSP module
    sample.rs      # Sample storage/playback
    filter.rs      # Filter implementations
    effects.rs     # Effect processors
  machines/
    mod.rs         # Machine types module
    ram_record.rs  # RAM RECORD machine
    ram_play.rs    # RAM PLAY machine
  gui/
    mod.rs         # GUI module (stub)
```

### 4. Create Minimal Plugin Scaffold
- Implement basic nih-plug plugin trait
- Define placeholder parameters
- Verify plugin compiles

### 5. Test Build
```bash
cargo build --release
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `cargo build --release` succeeds with no errors
- [ ] Plugin binary (.vst3 or .clap) is generated in target/release
- [ ] All directories and stub files created as specified
- [ ] Cargo.toml contains correct nih-plug dependencies
- [ ] Plugin can be loaded by nih-plug validator

title: Implement ultrawave VST/CLAP plugin - Elektron Machinedrum UW emulation
description:
Create a high-quality, professional Rust-based VST/CLAP plugin using nih-plugin that accurately emulates the Elektron Machinedrum UW RAM RECORD and RAM PLAY machines as specified in ELEKTRON appendix A-15. This plugin will replicate the realtime sample recording and playback functionality with exact parameter mappings, providing advanced audio manipulation features for digital audio workstations.

## Objectives
- Deliver a production-ready audio plugin that captures the essence of Elektron's legendary RAM machines
- Implement exact ELEKTRON appendix A-15 specifications for RAM RECORD (R1-R4) and RAM PLAY (P1-P4) machines
- Provide musicians and producers with powerful, creative sampling tools with authentic hardware behavior
- Ensure low-latency, high-performance operation in professional DAW environments
- Maintain compatibility across Windows, macOS, and Linux platforms

## Scope
### In Scope
- **Exact emulation of RAM RECORD machines (R1-R4)** with all appendix A-15 parameters:
  - MLEV (Main Level): Sets level of internal sound from Main outputs (0-127)
  - MBAL (Main Balance): Monophonic recording balance from Main outputs (0-127)
  - ILEV (Input Level): Sets level from external inputs (0-127)
  - IBAL (Input Balance): Monophonic recording balance from external inputs (0-127)
  - CUE1: Pre-listening level for Main/external inputs (0-127)
  - CUE2: Pre-listening level for recording trigger (0-127)
  - LEN (Length): Recording duration (0-127, 127 = 2 bars, each step = 1/64 step)
  - RATE: Recording quality control (0-127, lower values = lower quality, saves DSP memory)

- **Exact emulation of RAM PLAY machines (P1-P4)** functioning exactly like ROM machines 25-48:
  - Full ROM machine parameter set: Start, End, Length, Hold, Sample Rate, Decay, Trigger, Repeats
  - All track effects: Amplitude Modulation, 1-Band EQ, Resonant Filter, Sample Rate Reduction, Distortion
  - Complete modulation targets for all parameters
  - LFO synchronization and parameter lock support

- **RAM Machine Tutorial Workflow**: Implement the complete workflow from ELEKTRON appendix A-15:
  - Recording from Main outputs with MLEV=0, ILEV=-64
  - LEN=64 and RATE=127 for 1-bar maximum quality capture
  - Playback with parameter-locked STRT manipulation
  - Real-time recording and playback with CUE monitoring

- High-quality time-stretching with multiple algorithms
- Comprehensive filter system with drive and modulation
- Effects chains (delay, reverb, distortion, etc.)
- LFO and parameter modulation system
- Intuitive GUI with Elektron-inspired aesthetic
- Preset management with factory and user presets
- VST3 and CLAP format support
- MIDI note triggering and parameter automation

### Out of Scope
- Hardware integration or physical modeling
- Multi-machine chaining (focus on single machine emulation)
- Live recording workflow (external recording workflow assumed)
- Third-party plugin hosting
- Real-time collaboration features

## Deliverables
- Cross-platform VST3/CLAP plugin binaries
- Factory preset bank showcasing RAM machine capabilities
- User manual and documentation with appendix A-15 parameter reference
- Demo project files
- Source code repository

## Success Criteria
- Plugin passes all major DAW compatibility tests
- Audio quality matches or exceeds Elektron hardware standards
- CPU usage remains under 5% for single instance on modern hardware
- Zero crashes or stability issues in extended testing
- Positive user feedback from beta testers
- Commercial viability for plugin marketplace distribution
- **100% parameter accuracy with ELEKTRON appendix A-15 specifications**

title: Implement audio routing and mixing system
description:
Implement audio routing and mixing system.

## Routing Architecture

### Per-Machine Routing
```
Machine Output → Track Effects → Pan → Volume → Send 1/2 → Main Bus
                                              ↓
                                        Effect Returns
```

### Send System
- Send 1: To Delay (Rhythm Echo)
- Send 2: To Reverb (Gatebox)
- Pre/post fader option

### Master Section
- Stereo main bus
- Master volume
- Limiter (optional)

## Parameters Per Track
| Parameter | Range | Description |
|-----------|-------|-------------|
| VOL | 0-127 | Track volume |
| PAN | 0-127 | Stereo pan (64=center) |
| SND1 | 0-127 | Send 1 level |
| SND2 | 0-127 | Send 2 level |

## Master Effects (separate tasks)
- Delay: ultrawave-58d
- Reverb: ultrawave-58d
- Compressor (Dynamix): ultrawave-58d
- Master EQ: ultrawave-58d

## Technical Requirements
- Proper gain staging
- No clipping on summing
- Smooth parameter changes

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] 8 machines route to main bus correctly
- [ ] Pan law implemented (equal power or linear)
- [ ] Send levels work correctly
- [ ] No clipping on loud material
- [ ] Volume changes are smooth
- [ ] Stereo imaging correct
acceptance_criteria: Audio routing is flexible and intuitive. Pan and level controls work correctly. Signal chain maintains proper gain staging. Stereo processing is accurate and artifact-free.
